subject: physics
title: Superposition and Interference of Waves MCQ Problems

problems.author: Cabir Abassov
problems.question: What does superposition of waves mean?
options: Waves pass through each other and their displacements add
Waves combine and travel as one permanent wave
problems.hint: Consider how two waves behave when they meet.
problems.detailed: Superposition means when two or more waves travel through the same region, their displacements at each point add algebraically, but they continue unaffected after crossing.

problems.author: Cabir Abassov
problems.question: What is constructive interference?
options: When wave crests meet crests and amplitudes amplify
When crest meets trough and they cancel
When waves travel in opposite directions
problems.detailed: Constructive interference is when two waves are in phase (crest meets crest or trough meets trough), so their amplitudes add to make a larger amplitude.

problems.author: Cabir Abassov
problems.question: What is destructive interference?
options: Waves meeting out of phase causing cancellation
problems.detailed: Destructive interference occurs when waves are out of phase (crest meets trough) so that their displacements partially or fully cancel each other.

problems.author: Cabir Abassov
problems.question: If two equal amplitude waves meet in perfect phase, what is the resulting amplitude?
problems.hint: When constructive interference is perfect, amplitudes add fully.
problems.detailed: If two waves of amplitude \(A\) meet in phase, the resultant displacement is \(A + A = 2A\), so amplitude doubles.

problems.author: Cabir Abassov
problems.question: Which principle allows us to add wave displacements when they overlap?
problems.hint: The concept is named after this principle itself.
problems.detailed: The superposition principle states that the net displacement from overlapping waves is the sum of their individual displacements.
